Can Indian Economy expect revival despite rising inflation? What do you think are the major steps that can be taken in present circumstances to push growth in the country?

Due to rising inflation there are many problems faced by individuals in our country.Indian economy plays a major role in deciding the policies,rules and regulations that are to be followed by individuals.So in order to control inflation many new policies are to be incorporated to overcome the problems faced by individuals due to inflation.

Theses days the major problem that is faced by our Indian Economy is decreasing value of rupee this can be due to several reasons and one main reason can be due to increasing imports and decreasing exports.

So care should be taken in utilising the available resources properly and producing the products instead of importing them from foreign countries.This inturn helps in improving the GDP of the country.The most important aspect that can be concentrated is giving highest prority to agriculture industry.

Political parties should concentrate more in order to reduce poverty by providing special schemes and policies.Well educated people prefer working in foreign countries and try to gain more benefits and use their talent in building foreign country's economy.This practise should be changed and each individual should feel responsible and work in their own country and help in increasing their country's economy.

Technology also plays a crucial role because innovation of new technologies may reduce the work of individuals to a greater extent and helps to accomplish the task in best and effective way.These days political parties are working for their own benefits and people who are choosing their leaders should be very careful in electing their leaders.

A detailed survey should be made and analysed to know where and in which industry the country is facing many problems and care should be taken to reduce the problems to get more profits through which our Indian Economy can expect revival despite rising inflation.
